cleaned.title: [TEMP CHECK] Onboard SCR to Aave V3 Scroll Instance
cleaned.author: 0xEd039871ec71FBDC3D714517cE97030Dd2E88622

raw.title: [TEMP CHECK] Onboard SCR to Aave V3 Scroll Instance
raw.author: 0xEd039871ec71FBDC3D714517cE97030Dd2E88622
raw.body:
Author: ACI
Date: 2024-10-23
Simple Summary:
The current TEMP CHECK aims to onboard SCR, the native token of Scroll, on the Aave V3 Scroll Instance. This onboarding will allow Aave users to supply and borrow SCR, thereby enhancing the utility and liquidity of the Scroll token within the DeFi ecosystem and more specifically, within the Aave ecosystem.

Motivation/Background:
Scroll is an Ethereum Layer 2 chain which already has an Aave instance deployment and SCR is the governance token for the Scroll L2. By onboarding SCR to Aave V3, we aim to create new opportunities for Aave users to engage with this emerging staking ecosystem, while expanding SCR’s liquidity.

Benefits of listing this token:

Provide opportunities for Aave users to borrow against their SCR to unlock liquidity, or alternatively to borrow SCR against other collateral allowing them to participate in Scroll governance.

Market Impact:

We see no significant market impact from onboarding SCR except for providing new opportunities to Aave users which may cause users to switch from borrowing other tokens against their collateral. Overall we see onboarding SCR as net good for Aave users as it expands opportunities for them to engage in a new L2 ecosystem.

Chain to be deployed/listed:

Scroll.

Proof of Liquidity (POL) and Deposit Commitments:

POL and Deposit Commitments will be discussed at the ARFC stage. SCR will be included in future incentives programs.

Useful Links:
Scroll website 1
Scroll docs
Disclaimer:
This proposal is powered by Skywards. ACI is not directly affiliated with Scroll and did not receive compensation for creation of this proposal.

ACI and ACI employees may be holders of SCR.

Next Steps:
If consensus is reached on this TEMP CHECK, escalate this proposal to the Snapshot stage.
If the Snapshot outcome is YAE, escalate to ARFC stage.
Publication of a standard ARFC, collect community & service providers feedback before escalating proposal to ARFC snapshot stage.
If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal.
Copyright:
Copyright and related rights waived under CC0

cleaned.title: [TEMP CHECK] Onboard EIGEN to Aave V3 Ethereum
cleaned.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193

raw.title: [TEMP CHECK] Onboard EIGEN to Aave V3 Ethereum
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
## **Author: ACI**

## **Date: 2024-10-04**

---

### **Simple Summary:**

The current TEMP CHECK aims to onboard EIGEN, the native token of Eigenlayer, in Aave V3 Ethereum Market. This onboarding will allow Aave users to supply and borrow EIGEN, thereby enhancing the utility and liquidity of the Eigenlayer token within the DeFi ecosystem and more specifically, within the Aave ecosystem.

### **Motivation/Background:**

Eigenlayer is a protocol focused on shared security and restaking, enabling Ethereum stakers to extend their security guarantees to multiple services and protocols. EIGEN is the governance and utility token for Eigenlayer, playing a critical role in the network’s operations, staking mechanisms, and protocol governance. By onboarding EIGEN to Aave V3, we aim to create new opportunities for Aave users to engage with this emerging staking ecosystem, while expanding EIGEN's liquidity.

**Benefits of listing that token:** 

Provide opportunities for Aave users to borrow against their EIGEN to unlock liquidity, or alternatively to borrow EIGEN against other collateral allowing them to stake it in the Eigenlayer ecosystem to earn rewards.

**Market Impact:** 

We see no significant market impact from onboarding EIGEN except for providing new opportunities to Aave users which may cause users to switch from borrowing other tokens against their collateral. Overall we see onboarding EIGEN as net good for Aave users as it expands opportunities for them to engage in a new, important ecosystem.

**Chain to be deployed/listed:** 

Ethereum Mainnet

**Proof of Liquidity (POL) and Deposit Commitments:** 

POL and Deposit Commitments will be discussed at the ARFC stage.

### **Useful Links:**

- [Eigenlayer website](https://eigenfoundation.org/)
- [Eigenlayer documentation](https://docs.eigenfoundation.org/category/faq-eigen-token-overview)

### **Disclaimer:**

This proposal is powered by Skywards. The Aave Chan Initiative is not directly affiliated with Eigenlayer Foundation and did not receive compensation for creation this proposal.

ACI and ACI employees may be holders of EIGEN.

### **Next Steps:**

1. If consensus is reached on this TEMP CHECK, escalate this proposal to the Snapshot stage.
2. If the Snapshot outcome is YAE, escalate to ARFC stage.
3. Publication of a standard ARFC, collect community & service providers feedback before escalating proposal to ARFC snapshot stage.
4. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal.

### **Copyright:**

Copyright and related rights waived under [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/)

raw.title: [ARFC] Onboard slisBNB to Aave V3 on BNB Chain
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
## [ARFC] Onboard slisBNB to Aave V3 on BNB Chain
## Author: ACI
## Date: 2024-07-25
---
Risk Parameters have been updated after Risk Service Providers feedback 2024-07-29

### Summary
This proposal seeks to onboard slisBNB, a tokenized version of staked BNB introduced by Lista DAO, to Aave V3 on the BNB Chain.

### **Motivation**

slisBNB is a Liquid Staking Token (LST) from ListaDAO, which aims to bring additional liquidity and utility to staked BNB. The token allows users to participate in the staking rewards while maintaining the flexibility to use their staked assets within the DeFi ecosystem.

Onboarding slisBNB will allow Aave users to utilize it as collateral, thus broadening the asset base and enhancing overall liquidity.

### Proof of Liquidity and Deposit Commitments

Users who supply slisBNB liquidity on Aave, will be eligible to get stardust (points) from Lista's ongoing point system Cosmic Adventure Challenge Season 3, which will turn to LISTA token airdrop when Season 3 ends.

### Specification

Token Name: slisBNB

Underlying Asset: Staked BNB

Contract: 0xB0b84D294e0C75A6abe60171b70edEb2EFd14A1B

> Risk Parameters and analysis have been provided by Risk Service Providers so ARFC has been be updated accordingly.

|Parameter|Value|
|---|---|
|Isolation Mode|No|
|Borrowable|Yes|
|Borrowable in Isolation|No|
|Collateral Enabled|Yes|
|E-Mode Category|None|
|Supply Cap|20,000|
|Borrow Cap|2,000|
|Debt Ceiling|-|
|LTV|55%|
|LT|60%|
|Liquidation Bonus|7.50%|
|Liquidation Protocol Fee|10.00%|
|Variable Base|0.0%|
|Variable Slope1|7.00%|
|Variable Slope2|300.00%|
|Uoptimal|45.00%|
|Reserve Factor|15.00%|
|Stable Borrowing|Disabled|
|Flashloanable|Yes|
|Siloed Borrowing|No|


### **Useful Links:**

https://lista.org/

https://lista.org/liquid-staking/BNB

### Disclaimer:

This proposal is powered by Skywards. ACI is not directly affiliated with Lista DAO and did not receive compensation for creating this proposal.

### Next Steps

1. Publication of a standard ARFC, collect community & service providers feedback before escalating proposal to ARFC snapshot stage.
2. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal.

### Copyright:

Copyright and related rights waived under [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/)

raw.title: [ARFC] Onboard BNBx to Aave V3 BNB Chain
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
---

Title: [ARFC] Onboard BNBx to Aave V3 BNB Chain
Author: ACI (Aave Chan Initiative)
Date: 2024-05-27

---

### **Summary**
This ARFC proposes the addition of BNBx from Stader to Aave V3 BNB Chain to enhance LST liquidity and asset diversity.

## **Motivation**

BNBx is a liquid staked token of BNB from Stader. Users can freely mint BNBx in exchange for BNB deposits and earn yield from staking.

The Aave-Chan Initiative supports LST diversity in Aave V3 and looks to add more LST to the new BNB Chain deployment.

## **Specification**

Contract address: [0x1bdd3cf7f79cfb8edbb955f20ad99211551ba275](https://bscscan.com/token/0x1bdd3cf7f79cfb8edbb955f20ad99211551ba275)

| Parameter | Value |
| --- | --- |
| Isolation Mode | No |
| Borrowable | Yes |
| Collateral Enabled | Yes |
| Supply Cap (BNBx) | 5,000 |
| Borrow Cap (BNBx) | 500 |
| Debt Ceiling | NA |
| LTV | 65.00% |
| LT | 70.00% |
| Liquidation Bonus | 7.50% |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee | 10.00% |
| Variable Base | 0.0% |
| Variable Slope1 | 7.00% |
| Variable Slope2 | 300.00% |
| Uoptimal | 45.00% |
| Reserve Factor | 15.00% |
| Stable Borrowing | Disabled |
| Flahloanable  | Yes |
| Siloed Borrowing | No |
| Borrowed in Isolation | No |

Risk Parameters have been provided by Risk Service Providers and ARFC has been updated.

## **Useful Links**

- Website: https://www.staderlabs.com/
- BNBx docs: https://binance.docs.staderlabs.com/
- [TEMP CHECK](https://governance.aave.com/t/temp-check-onboard-bnbx-on-aave-v3-bnb-chain/16850)
- [TEMP CHECK Snapshot](https://snapshot.org/#/aave.eth/proposal/0x9510ea1d3c9fd0f1fd67b05860ca2f1dafb65b983ff1f81d962b7dea0c47b13b)

## Disclaimer

The ACI is not presenting this ARFC on behalf of any third party and is not compensated for creating this ARFC.

## Next Steps

1. Publication of a standard ARFC, collect community & service providers feedback before escalating proposal to ARFC snapshot stage
2. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal

## Copyright

Copyright and related rights waived via [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/).

cleaned.title: [ARFC] Onboard FRAX to Aave v3 Lido Instance
cleaned.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193

raw.title: [ARFC] Onboard FRAX to Aave v3 Lido Instance
raw.author: 0xF1dF824419879Bb8a7E758173523F88EfB7Af193
raw.body:
## **Author: ACI**

## **Date: 2024-10-04**

---
> ARFC has been updated with Risk Parameters provided by Risk Service Providers 2024-10-08

---

### **Summary**

This proposal aims to onboard FRAX to the Aave v3 Lido Instance.

### **Motivation**

The integration of FRAX into the Aave v3 Lido Instance is driven by the following factors:

1. FRAX Adoption: Frax is also taking a new place in Aave ecosystem with harmonization between FRAX and USDC parameters.
2. Liquidity Enhancement: The inclusion of this widely-used stablecoin is expected to boost liquidity in the Lido Instance, potentially attracting more users and increasing overall platform activity.
3. Strategic Alignment: This move aligns with Aave’s goal of offering a comprehensive suite of high-quality assets, keeping the protocol at the forefront of DeFi liquidity.

### **Proof of Liquidity and Deposit Commitments**

FRAX has pledged liquidity provision support. These will complement the ongoing incentives for the Lido Instance.

### **Specification**

Contract addresses:

FRAX: 0x853d955aCEf822Db058eb8505911ED77F175b99e

> ARFC has been updated with Risk Parameters provided by Risk Service Providers 2024-10-08

| **Parameter** | FRAX |
| --- | --- |
| Chain-Instance | Ethereum-Lido |
| Isolation Mode | No |
| Borrowable | Yes |
| Collateral Enabled | No |
| Supply Cap | 20,000,000 |
| Borrow Cap | 18,000,000 |
| Debt Ceiling | - |
| LTV | - |
| LT | - |
| Liquidation Bonus | - |
| Liquidation Protocol Fee | - |
| Variable Base | 0% |
| Variable Slope1 | 5.5% |
| Variable Slope2 | 75% |
| Uoptimal | 90% |
| Reserve Factor | 20% |
| Stable Borrowing | Disabled |
| Flashloanable | Yes |
| Siloed Borrowing | Disabled |
| Borrowable in Isolation | No |
| E-Mode Category | - |

### **Disclaimer:**

This proposal is powered by Skywards. ACI is not directly affiliated with FRAX and did not receive compensation for creation of this proposal.

**Next Steps**

1. If consensus is reached on this [ARFC], escalate this proposal to the Snapshot stage.
2. If the ARFC snapshot outcome is YAE, publish an AIP vote for final confirmation and enforcement of the proposal.

### **Copyright:**

Copyright and related rights waived under [CC0](https://creativecommons.org/publicdomain/zero/1.0/)

decision.summary: This proposal seeks to onboard SCR, the native token of Scroll, onto the Aave V3 Scroll instance as a non-collateral asset, enabling borrowing and supply functionalities but not collateral use. The token is new with significant governance and tokenomics risks, including high concentration of supply in multisigs and EOAs, lack of verified vesting enforcement, and volatile market behavior. Past similar proposals to onboard liquid E-Mode assets on Aave v3 showed strong unanimous support and positive market impact, supporting a positive outlook. Forum sentiment is mixed to negative but largely neutral in recent discussion, reflecting cautious community stance.
key_arguments_for: Enables Aave users to borrow and supply SCR, expanding utility and liquidity in the Scroll ecosystem.
Past similar onboarding proposals for liquid E-Mode assets showed unanimous voting support and modest positive market impact.
The supply and borrow caps are conservatively set to mitigate risks from high volatility and liquidity concerns.
Onboarding SCR as a non-collateral asset avoids exposure to collateral-related risks amid early-stage token governance and distribution uncertainties.
key_arguments_against: High concentration of SCR supply in multisigs controlled by few signers with no onchain enforcement of vesting schedules.
Significant downside volatility risk demonstrated by price and TVL declines post launch and distribution events.
Lack of Chainlink price feed and inactive governance system introduce risks to protocol security and parameter updates.
Forum sentiment and risk analyses highlight community concerns about token distribution fairness and governance centralization.

evidence.quote: Forum shows 6 comments before deadline: 3 negative sentiment highlighting risks, 3 neutral. Early posts detail token specs and governance concerns.
Timeline metrics show unanimous and stable early and total vote lead for YAE option with strong voting power concentration.

evidence.reference: [ARFC] Enable tBTC/WBTC liquid E-Mode on Aave v3 Mainnet and similar proposals
evidence.quote: Similar proposals showed unanimous voting support with YAE winning >90% vote power margin and modest positive price and TVL impact.

decision.simulation_reason: Recommendation based on timeline voting dynamics, forum sentiment, and historical similar proposals, not on post-vote tally.
decision.ai_final_conclusion: Option 'YAE' selected with stance to keep 'Change'.
decision.ai_final_reason:
• Timeline voting analysis shows unanimous and stable support for YAE option with dominant early and total vote lead.
• Adjacent similar proposals onboarded liquid E-Mode assets with strong YAE wins and positive market impacts, supporting cautious optimism.
• Forum sentiment is mixed, with negative comments highlighting risks and neutral comments informing but not opposing onboarding; recommendation aligns with majority voting and market outlook rather than forum negativity.
• High token concentration and governance risks justify conservative onboarding as non-collateral asset with supply and borrow caps to limit exposure.
• Overall, recommendation to change (onboard SCR as non-collateral asset) supports Aave’s strategic expansion and ecosystem growth while mitigating early-stage risks.
